Subject: Blocking Yubikeys whitelisted
Description: Issue: Yubikeys with the following IDs are globally whitelisted: VID: 1050 PID: 407 Description: Since Monday, February 17, 2025, Yubikeys that are actually globally whitelisted have suddenly been blocked for no apparent reason. The first problem reports were received at around 4:30 p.m. CET. However, according to logs, the first blockings began at 7:22 a.m. CET. According to logs, Yubikeys are currently still being blocked. The Operations Team has whitelisted the affected Yubikey globally again. At the moment, the blocking seems to be lifted as soon as the affected computer updates the policies. Expectation: Request a statement as to why the Yubikey with the mentioned VID and PID is blocked and what is the reason behind this. How can problems of this kind be prevented in the future? Unfortunately, it cannot be said with certainty whether the problem has actually been resolved, as according to logs it still occurs. Does the issue still exist? Hint: Unfortunately, it is not possible to provide log files. Log report "exportgenerated_1739964503283_0.xlsx" has been attached. Screenshot "C:UsersQXS4852DownloadsEP_Device_Control_Global_Rights_Yubikeys_2025-02-19.jpg" of Yubikey whitelisted globally is attached as well. Please give us a statement as requested. Thank you.
What_We_Know__c:
- Finished the investigation in the backend with Mihaela
- the initial assessment is that this temporary blockage was caused by the fact that the computers were deleted on Monday, and until the reconnected with the MC, to update the policies, the devices were blocked.
- the devices have now the right Allowed Access

15 April 2025

- the customer confirmed that he is satisfied with the explanation and that the ticket can be closed
Next_Steps__c:
- Investigate in the backend
- communicate the statement to the customers

15 April 2025: closing ticket as per customer confirmation
Solution_Comment__c: The customer confirmed that he is satisfied with the explanation and that the ticket can be closed
